Material used.Material Name: NIH3T3, 293T, Flp - InNIH3T3, DJ - 1 - knockdown cell line (D2 cells)
Material used.Description: Human 293T and mouse Flp - InNIH3T3 cells were cultured in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium with 10% calf serum. DJ - 1 - knockdown cell line was established by transfecting an siRNA vector targeting mouse DJ - 1 gene into mouse Flp - In3T3 cells. Cells were cultured in a 96 - well plate and treated with various amounts of hydrogen peroxide for 12 or 24 h.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (HGVS not standardized as no relevant data)
Readout description.Conclusion: L166P and C106S cells were sensitive to H₂O₂; M26I and R98Q lines followed in terms of sensitivity to H₂O₂; D149A cells were resistant to cell death
Readout description.Molecular Effect: L166P and C106S had little activities for scavenging ROS under a condition of no oxidative stress; other mutants had reduced activities to eliminate exogenously added H₂O₂
Readout description.Result Description: Cells harboring exogenously added wild - type DJ - 1 were much more resistant to H₂O₂ than were parental cells. D2 cells, DJ - 1 - knockdown cells, were found to be most sensitive to H₂O₂. Of the cell lines harboring DJ - 1 mutants, L166P and C106S cells were sensitive to H₂O₂, and M26I and R98Q lines followed in terms of sensitivity to H₂O₂. The M26I cell line was much more sensitive to a high dose of H₂O₂ than was the R98Q cell line. D149A cells were resistant to cell death, and the viability of D149A cells was almost the same as that of the wild - type cells.

Biological replicates.Description: More than five experiments were carried out.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on knowledge, normal cell viability would be high in the absence of H₂O₂ stress)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on knowledge, abnormal cell viability would be low in the presence of H₂O₂ stress)

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Analysis of dimer formation (immunoprecipitation and blotting; yeast two - hybrid assay)

Material used.Material Name: Human 293T cells, Saccharomyces cerevisiae L40 cells, mouse NIH3T3 cell lines
Material used.Description: Human 293T cells were transfected with expression vectors for FLAG - DJ - 1 and HA - DJ - 1. Saccharomyces cerevisiae L40 cells were cotransformed with pGLex - DJ - 1 and various mutant constructs fused with the GAL4 activation domain. Mouse NIH3T3 cell lines harboring exogenously added Flag - tagged wild - type DJ - 1 or various mutants of DJ - 1 were used.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (HGVS not standardized as no relevant data)
Readout description.Conclusion: All of the mutants formed heterodimers with wild - type DJ - 1; all of the mutants except for L166P formed homodimers
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Disruption of dimer formation of DJ - 1 abrogates anti - oxidative stress function
Readout description.Result Description: In 293T cells, HA - DJ - 1 was coprecipitated with FLAG - DJ - 1 only when both vectors were transfected, indicating wild - type DJ - 1 forms a homodimer. In yeast two - hybrid assay, all mutants bound to wild - type DJ - 1 as heterodimers, and all except L166P formed homodimers. In NIH3T3 cells, all mutants were co - immunoprecipitated with endogenous DJ - 1, though less DJ - 1 was coprecipitated with L166P DJ - 1.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on knowledge, normal would be the formation of dimers as in wild - type)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on knowledge, abnormal would be the lack of dimer formation)

Material used.Description: Mouse NIH3T3 cell lines harboring exogenously added Flag - tagged wild - type or various mutants of DJ - 1 were cultured in the presence or absence of proteasome inhibitor, MG132.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (HGVS not standardized as no relevant data)
Readout description.Conclusion: M26I and L166P were unstable; D149A was more stable than wild - type DJ - 1; all mutants in Parkinson's disease patients were degraded, in part, by the proteasome system
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Degradation by proteasome system affects protein stability
Readout description.Result Description: In the absence of MG132, the amounts of M26I and L166P DJ - 1 were smaller than that of wild - type DJ - 1, and amount of D149A was larger. In the presence of MG132, amounts of all of the mutants of DJ - 1 found in Parkinson's disease patients increased, while the amounts of wild - type DJ - 1 and C106S were not affected.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on knowledge, normal would be stable protein levels as in wild - type)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on knowledge, abnormal would be unstable protein levels)

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Analysis of ROS scavenging activity (flow - cytometry with DCFH - DA)

Material used.Material Name: NIH3T3 cell lines, DJ - 1 - knockdown cell line (D2 cells)
Material used.Description: NIH3T3 cell lines harboring exogenously added wild - type or various mutants of DJ - 1, and D2 cells were treated with DCFH - DA with or without prior treatment of H₂O₂.

Readout description.Variant: N.D. (HGVS not standardized as no relevant data)
Readout description.Conclusion: L166P and C106S had little activities for scavenging ROS under a condition of no oxidative stress; other mutants had reduced activities to eliminate exogenously added H₂O₂
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Mutations affect the ability to scavenge ROS
Readout description.Result Description: Cell lines expressing L166P and C106S mutants had high fluorescence intensity, indicating little ROS - scavenging activity. Other cell lines expressing DJ - 1 mutants had reduced activities to eliminate exogenously added H₂O₂. D2 cells showed curves similar to parental NIH3T3 cells and cells expressing wild - type DJ - 1 under no stress, but had little activity to eliminate exogenously added H₂O₂.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on knowledge, normal would be low fluorescence intensity indicating effective ROS scavenging)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on knowledge, abnormal would be high fluorescence intensity indicating poor ROS scavenging)
